poem:
Title: "Classrooms of Faith"

The chalk marks 
on the blackboard—
a testament, traced with dust.

Jewish children, young gold minds,
elucidating differences, delicate
as slivered almonds.

Privilege of insight—
learning in the arms of
divergent faiths.

These bricks, a growing tower.
Children becoming bridges,
to bring closer the far stars.

Ministers, they mason walls—
yet within our classrooms,
we kneel at the cathedral of curiosity.
